backendType.description: Determines which backend to use for fetching secrets

controllerId.description: The ID of controller instance that manages this ExternalSecret. This is needed in case there is more than a KES controller instances within the cluster.

isBinary.description: Whether the backend secret shall be treated as binary data represented by a base64-encoded string. You must set this to true for any base64-encoded binary data in the backend - to ensure it is not encoded in base64 again. Default is false.

name.description: Name set for this key in the generated secret

path.description: Path from SSM to scrape secrets This will fetch all secrets and use the key from the secret as variable name

property.description: Property to extract if secret in backend is a JSON object

recursive.description: Allow to recurse thru all child keys on a given path, default false

secretType.description: Used by: ibmcloudSecretsManager Type of secret - one of username_password, iam_credentials or arbitrary

isBinary.description: Whether the backend secret shall be treated as binary data represented by a base64-encoded string. You must set this to true for any base64-encoded binary data in the backend - to ensure it is not encoded in base64 again. Default is false.

keyByName.description: Whether to interpret the key as a secret name (if true) or ID (the default). Used by: ibmcloudSecretsManager

kvVersion.description: Vault K/V version either 1 or 2, default = 2

template.description: Template which will be deep merged without mutating any existing fields. into generated secret, can be used to set for example annotations or type on the generated secret
